description.narrative: The water deficit, according to the contingency plans of the communes Bugabira and Busoni, is the main challenge that threatens theflourishing of the environment and therefore the decrease of the consumption of carbon. The logic of our intervention is to contribute to the stabilization of the rainfall rate through the implementation of shelterbelts in the arid zones of the commune Busoni especially in the zones Gatare and Gisenyi and the commune Bugabira in the zones of Kiyonza, Kigina and Kigoma. Theseschemes consist ofcommunity reforestation on bare hills, afforestation to protect public infrastructure and agro-forestrytrees planted in vertical and horizontal lines by the members of the groups in order to curb the speed of the winds whatever its direction. To stabilize the rainfall, it is essential to protect the lakes, which are vast expanses of water that irrigate the region through evaporation. This protection consists of delimiting the buffer zones of the lakes by the Euphorbia turcali (iminyari) 50 m around these lakes and planting trees that purify the air and stop the discharge of plant debris into the lakes. The project plans to plant in these buffer zones in particular with the species of Grevilea, cedrela, Maesopsis, bamboos (Imisuna) andIndara. In this case, we will not only protect the buffer zone but also restore the spawning zone of the fish in order to increase the volume of poisons in these lakes. The effects of soil erosion on the hills overlooking the 8 northern lakes are profoundly altering the ecosystem of these lakes. So there is the emergence of new animal and plant species, most often expressed as parasites. To cope with this, anti-erosion control devices areessential. For the case of our intervention, 40 km of anti-erosionpits (FAE) are planned to Lake Rweru and Lake Cohoha near Bugabira and Busoni and vegetate them with fixative herbs (Bana glass). Overall objective Contribute to controlling the water deficit in the natural region of Bugesera and to restoring the ecosystem of Lake Cohoha and Lake Rweru respectively in the municipalities of Bugabira and Busoni. Specific objectives • Promote the protection of the Cohoha and Rweru Lakes watersheds using the Cash for Work and Buy Results approaches; • Promote the stabilization of biodiversity in buffer and marine areas of Cohoha and Rweru lakes; • Promote the reinforcement of wind speed slowing devices driving rain-laden clouds. EXPECTED RESULTS AND ACTIONS TO BE TAKEN In order to carryout the project successfully, it is essential to determine the medium and short-term results, the activities to be carried out and the related indicators that will facilitate the monitoring and evaluation of the project. Activity1: Dig and vegetate 40 km of levelcurve around lakesRweru and Cohoha respectively 10 km per hill on the 4 hills of our area of action (buying results approach . Activity 2: Plant agro-forestry plants in the properties of the members of the groups and the surrounding community where the level curves have passed to increase the stability of the latter by the «buy results» approach

participating-org.narrative: «Entente Mutuelle et Solidarité, EMUSO en sigle» is a non-profit organization that has been working in the community since 2004 andwas approved by the Ministerial Order of 26 May 2006. In accordance with the new law of 2017 governing non-profit associations, ourorganization has already had its notice No 530/491/CAB/2019. EMUSO has as organs: a general assembly, an executive committee and a supervisory committee. EMUSO works in the field of women’s economic empowerment, environmental protection, food and nutrition security and peace building. Burundi is one of the countries that puts special efforts in the promotion of the environment through the preservation, restoration and conservation of environmental heritage or even many conventions that it has ratified (Convention on Biological Diversity ratified in March 2009) To achieve this, Burundi has multiplied many initiatives in the establishment of the ministry in charge of the environment and the platformA national form of Disaster Risk Reduction and Management that is subdivided into different membranes down to the communal level. EMUSO is a member of the provincial platform and participates in the development and evaluation of provincial contingency plans. The Ministry of Environment, Agriculture and Livestock through the Office Burundaise de la Protection de l'Environnement (OBPE) recognizes 5 protected environmental landscapes where the province of Kirundo houses the protected aquatic landscape of the North (PAPN) consisting of 8 lakes and the Murehe nature reserve. This PAPN is highly threatened by the demographic pressure imposed on it by the population in terms of the right of use.
